content: Insurance Retirement CPF SeedlyTV EP06 Asked by AnonymousAsked on 31 Jul 2019What insurance products, other than ILPs, can you get using your CPF accounts?According to CPF, you can purchase annuities, and endowment plans. May I know which company provides these products and which would you recommend for my retirement?2 answersAnswerBump0

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomUpdated on 01 Aug 2019You used to be able to purchase endowment and annuities with CPF monies, you can't anymore, now with OA and SA monies you can only purchase a Single Premium ILP. For your Medisave accounts, you can purchase an Integrated Shield Plan and also an Eldershield Supplement (soon Careshield Life variant).Other then the basic, already given to you, DPS, HPS, MSL, ES, CPF Life, that's it.2 comments4

Question Poster31 Jul 2019Hi Hariz, thanks for your swift answer. Really helpful. Is it the same for CPFIA?Hariz Arthur Maloy01 Aug 2019CPFIS allows you to invest in quite a few things. Some stocks on SGX, Gold, and of course Unit Trust either direct or through an ILP.
